page.title: 03NEW CROPS
page.content: Brilliant yellow fields were seen for the first time this year in Nithsdale. These are fields of oilseed rape. Almost 10% of the land around Thornhill is growing this crop in response to subsidies offered by the E.E.C.. Planted in the autumn it was in full flower during the survey in June and, after the seed pods ripen, it will be mowed in swathes, then combined. The seeds are to be processed into vegetable oil and the remains of the plant ploughed back into the soil to enrich it. Another new crop in 1985 is the protein pea which covers 4% of the land around Thornhill. This is a low growing pea which will be harvested and used to enrich the farmers animal fodders. Being of the pea family it also improves the soil.
